name: initialize_empty_2d_list
docstring:
Initializes an empty 2D list with the given dimensions.

Parameters
----------
rows : int
    The number of rows in the 2D list.
cols : int
    The number of columns in the 2D list.

Returns
-------
list[list[None]]
    The 2D list initialized with None values.
examples:
To use this function, you would call it with the desired number of rows and columns:

>>> empty_2d_list = initialize_empty_2d_list(3, 4)
>>> empty_2d_list
[[None, None, None, None], [None, None, None, None], [None, None, None, None]]

Another example with different dimensions:

>>> empty_2d_list = initialize_empty_2d_list(2, 2)
>>> empty_2d_list
[[None, None], [None, None]]
